title: Judge denies Hunter Biden video court hearing on gun charges
description: DOJ special counsel David Weiss opposed a video court hearing for Hunter Biden, the son of President Joe Biden, in the case charging him with gun crimes.

title: Amazon gives Alexa an AI facelift as it launches new smart speakers
description: Amazon introduced new hardware and software with generative artificial intelligence features on Wednesday.

title: Netanyahu says Israel and Saudi Arabia 'can forge a historic peace' with Biden's help
description: Biden met with Netanyahu on the sidelines of the U.N. summit and agreed to work toward establishing diplomatic relations between Saudi Arabia and Israel.

title: Deep-sea mining could help solve the global critical minerals shortage, but it's a lightning rod for controversy
description: There are billions of tons of critical minerals on the ocean floor, but whether they should be mined has become a global controversy.

title: Adidas CEO says Kanye West didn't mean antisemitic remarks, isn't a bad person
description: Adidas CEO Bjorn Gulden said Kanye West didn't mean it when he made antisemitic remarks that led to the end of his Yeezy collaboration with the company.

title: 37-year-old quit Amazon and started 20 companies before coming up with Instacart—now he's worth $1.1 billion
description: Apoorva Mehta is a billionaire, thanks to Instacart's IPO. But, before the grocery delivery startup took off, he tried and failed with 20 other businesses.

title: Fed declines to hike, but points to rates staying higher for longer
description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released its decision on interest rates and updates on the economy.

title: Klaviyo jumps 23% in NYSE debut after software vendor priced IPO at $30
description: Software developer Klaviyo debuted on the New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday, a day after Instacart started trading on the Nasdaq

title: Donald Trump Jr.'s social media account on X is hacked, false tweets posted
description: The social media account controlled by Donald Trump Jr. posted false tweets after it was hacked. One made a false claim about former President Donald Trump.

title: India urges 'utmost caution' in Canada travel advisory as bilateral crisis escalates
description: Ottawa is investigating "credible allegations" the Indian government may be connected to the murder of a prominent advocate for an independent Sikh homeland.

title: Apple and Goldman were planning stock-trading feature for iPhones until markets turned last year
description: Apple was exploring the launch of a feature that would let iPhone users buy and sell stocks, according to people familiar with the plans.

title: Britain set to roll back climate pledges, enraging campaigners and auto groups
description: The CEO of Ford UK said delaying the ban on new car sales running on petrol and diesel would undermine the government's "ambition, commitment and consistency."

title: Germany will become the sick man of Europe without change, Deutsche Bank CEO says
description: Deutsche Bank CEO Christian Sewing said Germany will become the sick man of Europe if "structural issues" are not addressed immediately.

title: Bank of England rate hike pause back on the table after inflation surprise
description: The Bank of England's next monetary policy move is now wide open, following a significant downside surprise in the August inflation print out on Wednesday.

title: ARK CEO Cathie Wood says she swerved the Arm IPO frenzy. Here's why
description: ARK Invest CEO Cathie Wood said she did not participate in Arm's IPO last week, as the chip designer was overvalued relative to its competitive position.

title: Global debt stock hit a record $307 trillion in the first half of 2023, top trade body says
description: The stock of global debt rose $10 trillion in the first half of 2023, bringing it to a new record high of $307 trillion, according to a report by the IIF.

title: Asian Development Bank trims growth forecast for region, dampened by Chinese property sector weakness
description: The Asian Development Bank trimmed its 2023 growth forecast for the region to 4.7% on the back of China's embattled property sector.

title: Europe is 'very far' from imposing new duties on Chinese EVs despite ongoing probe, top official says
description: The European Commission surprised many last week by announcing a probe into Chinese EV susidies.

title: UK inflation dips to 6.7%, below expectations as food prices ease
description: U.K. inflation came in at 6.7% in August, below expectations and down slightly from the previous month.

title: China exports zero germanium and gallium in August as national security curbs bite
description: Export curbs on these two chipmaking metals are part of China's escalating war with the U.S. and its allies over access to strategic technology.

title: 4 in 5 employees in Asia have moderate to high mental health risk, study shows
description: South Korea, Malaysia and Japan had the highest percentage of workers with a high risk of experiencing mental health issues, said a Aon and TELUS Health report.

title: Ford avoids Canadian auto strike with Unifor union deal
description: Ford and Unifor announced the agreement, which must still be ratified by members, hours before an extended 11:59 p.m. Tuesday deadline.

title: ‘Everything Everywhere’ Oscar winner Ke Huy Quan on Asia's 'huge influence' on how Hollywood stories are told
description: Asia has a "huge influence" on how Hollywood stories are being told, and that's due to how much the Chinese market has grown, said Oscar winner Ke Huy Quan.

title: China leaves benchmark lending rates unchanged in September
description: China's banks kept their benchmark loan rates unchanged for September, after the economy showed signs of stabilization following recent policy support.

title: Oil markets' decades-long dependence on China could be ending
description: China's oil demand is peaking by the end of the decade, and with its economic recovery still in limbo, how much can the global oil markets still rely on it?

title: Xi's economic policies are leaving many China watchers perplexed and confused
description: Most, though not all, China watchers point to Xi himself as the instigator of those recent changes.

title: UNESCO names new sites to its World Heritage List – including one in the West Bank
description: The World Heritage Committee named 27 new sites to UNESCO's World Heritage List. Two sites in Ukraine were named to its "in danger" list.
